# Options for Applying a Filter

**API Collection**

Options that control the application of a custom Core Image filter.

## Overview

Use these constants only when creating a custom filter for which you are writing the kernel. For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/GraphicsImaging/Conceptual/CoreImaging/ci_intro/ci_intro.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP30001185]. The example on creating a custom filter shows how to use these options.

## Constants

- **kCIApplyOptionExtent**: The extent of the image.
- **kCIApplyOptionDefinition**: The domain of definition (DOD) of the produced image.
- **kCIApplyOptionUserInfo**: Information needed by a callback. The associated value is an object that Core Image will pass to any callbacks invoked for that filter.
- **kCIApplyOptionColorSpace**: The color space of the produced image.

## Constants

- **Filter Attribute Keys**: Attributes for a filter and its parameters.
- **Data Type Attributes**: Numeric data types.
- **Vector Quantity Attributes**: Vector data types.
- **Color Attribute Keys**: Color types.
- **Image Attribute Keys**: Image Types
- **Filter Category Keys**: Categories of filters.
- **User Interface Control Options**: Sets of controls for various user scenarios.
- **User Interface Options**: Keys or values for the size of the input parameter controls for a filter view.
- **Filter Parameter Keys**: Keys for input parameters to filters.
- **RAW Image Options**: Options for creating a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIFilter-swift.class] object from RAW image data.
